result.execSummary:
The defendant Davonn J Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.  Good time to apply.

miscConds.notes: Set at $3,589.77 payable to Milwaukee Public Schools Audit Department.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges including DNA.  Failure to pay before the end of supervision will result in a civil judgment.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medications and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully  complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm and he may not vote until his civil rights are resotred.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction rights received and filed.

timeConds.notes: STAYED for use at the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davonn J Wilson

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Filed, sdg.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Davonn J Wilson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 52 days time served.  Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment, good time to apply.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed for use at the agent's discretion.
Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA. Failure to pay before the end of supervision will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution is set at $3,589.77 payable to Milwaukee Public Schools Audit Department. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights received and filed.
Filed: Defense Sentencing Materials

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Davonn J Wilson in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  COURT CONTINUED REMAND.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Davonn J Wilson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense OBJECTED due to having just been appointed.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  COURT CONTINUED REMAND UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Court took the motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT at this time.  Defendant to compose letter per instruction of the Court.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 30, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Filed, sdg.

Bench warrant cleared by the Milwaukee County Sheriff and in original warrant scanned in.  Clerk contacted SPD to appoint new counsel. Case is scheduled for return on the bench warrant on 04-03-2018 at 1:30 pm, Branch 33.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is back at school.  Review hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(2).  DWD and MPS.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to SANCTION the Defendant for a period of ONE (1) WEEK.  Defense advised that Defendant DOES wish to continue with the DPA.  Defendant advised that he will 'get it together' after the (possible) Sanction.  Defendant advised that he will stop smoking Marijuana.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense advised that after Defendant's last Sanction,  he had co-operated with everything asked of him in the DPA.  Defense did NOT request a Sanction.  Defendant advised that he wishes to finish school and reiterated that he will stop smoking Marijuana.  COURT IMPOSED A SANCTION OF ONE (1) WEEK.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
(PACKET).  Certificate of Completion and other documents on behalf of the Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court reviewed all proffered documents.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  State advised that Defendant has not made ANY restitution payments.  DPA is set to expire in early FEBRUARY, 2016.  Court took note that Defendant is doing much better than previous hearings.  Defense to provide documentation from Defendant's teacher(s) regarding attendance and homework.  State does not object to a brief adjournment.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Vincent Guimont for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter before the Court for Review.  Court notes the NEGATIVE UA's from JusticePoint.  Court admonished Defendant regarding the tardy he received from school.  Defendant will be beginning "Face Forward" this month.  State advises the Court that Defendant needs to pay restitution ($3,800.00),  attend school, test negative.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Davonn J Wilson in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT INTO THE CUSTODY OF THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

filed.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Davonn J Wilson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Randy Sitzberger for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
